intro: Orthocarpus tolmiei subsp. holmgreniorum, commonly known as the Hawaiian orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the species. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streamside areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic plant.
